 TestCase_GC00402_MultiSessionKeepAlive_DataPreserved () mc_multi_session_keep_alive)
 
 TestCase_GC00500_MultiInstance_ReadProperties () mc_multi_instance)
 
 TestCase_GC00501_MultiInstance_OpenMultiple () mc_multi_instance)
 
 TestCase_GC00502_MultiInstance_DataLost () mc_multi_instance)
 

Detailed Description

Description:
: This test intends to verify the behavior of TA properties "singleInstance", "multiSession" and "instanceKeepAlive" when called from a client application.

For this test, we will need different TAs: -TA multiple instance (singleInstance=False) -TA mono session (singleInstance=True multiSession=False instanceKeepAlive=False) -TA mono session keep alive (singleInstance=True multiSession=False instanceKeepAlive=True ) -TA multi session (singleInstance=True multiSession=True instanceKeepAlive=False) -TA multi session keep alive (singleInstance=True multiSession=True instanceKeepAlive=True )

Note : multiSession and instanceKeepAlive are not applicable when singleInstance=False

The TA code is the same between each TA (one function to set data and one function to get back these data). The only differences are the configuration properties.

Features of the TA: -save/retrieve variable values (for testing keep-alive) -can call another TA on command (to allow chaining multiple TAs in sequence), handled by a command list in memory + a pointer, which is then passed to each sub TA -can check properties and report them back to the client/CA -can write results into a data buffer to propagate back to the CA if a chain of TAs is used -provide an array of counters for keeping track of multi-instance counts (i.e. CA can pass an index value to the slave TA, then to the server TA) -provide a mutex (NOTE: not defined in GP API, TAs are single-threaded, so invokeCmd is always serialized)

The CA uses the following functions to access these TAs: TEEC_OpenSession() TEEC_CloseSession() TEEC_InvokeCommand()

Notes:

  • In general, most of the test code should be parameterized to allow reuse of the same test code for multiple configurations.
  • For random data, a seedable pseudo-random number generator should be used and the value recorded for each execution to allow reproducibility

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC00100_MonoSession_ReadProperties ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a mono session TA configured with instanceKeepAlive=False reports properties as expected.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a mono session TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Send a command to read the following properties: singleInstance, multiSession, and instanceKeepAlive. Close session and check that it succeeds. Verify that the properties are singleInstance=True multiSession=False instanceKeepAlive=False.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00100_MonoSession_ReadProperties
TestCase_GC00101_MonoSession_OpenOnce ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a mono session TA configured with instanceKeepAlive=False can only be opened once.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a mono session TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Try to open a second session of the same TA and check that the result is TEE_ERROR_BUSY Close first session and check that it succeeds.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00101_MonoSession_OpenOnce
TestCase_GC00102_MonoSession_DataLost ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a mono session TA configured with instanceKeepAlive=False does not keep its data between each close/OpenSession.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a mono session TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Send a command to read data and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Send a command with data that must be saved inside the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that it is the value that was previously sent. Close the session and check that it succeeds. Open a new session on the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Close session and check that it succeeds.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00102_MonoSession_DataLost

TestCase_GC00301_MultiSession_OpenMultiple ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a multi session TA configured with instanceKeepAlive=False can be opened multiple times.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a multi-session TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Do a loop 5 of: Open an additional session of the same TA and check that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Close all sessions in a random order and check that all closes succeed.

GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00301_MultiSession_OpenMultiple
TestCase_GC00302_MultiSession_DataLost ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a multi session TA configured with instanceKeepAlive=False does not keep its data between each close/OpenSession.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a multi-session TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Send a command to read data and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Send a command with data that must be saved inside the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that it is the value that was previously sent. Do a loop 5 of: Open an additional session of the same TA and check that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Send a command to read data and verify that the data are the value from the previous session. Send a command to write unique data into the TA (each session must use different data) Send a command to read data and verify that the data reflects the newly-written value. Send a command to read data from the first TA session and verify that it is the value that last session in the loop. Close all sessions (including the first session) in a random order and verify that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Open a new session on the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Close session and check that it succeeds.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00302_MultiSession_DataLost

TestCase_GC00402_MultiSessionKeepAlive_DataPreserved ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a multi-session TA configured with instanceKeepAlive=True keeps its data between each close/OpenSession.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a multi-session TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Send a command to read data and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Send a command with data that must be saved inside the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that it is the value that was previously sent. Close the session and check that it succeeds. Do a loop 5 of: Open an additional session of the same TA and check that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Send a command to read data and verify that the data matches what was previously written by the previously-opened TA. Send a command to write unique data into the TA (each session must use different data) Send a command to read data and verify that the data reflects the newly-written value. Close all sessions in a random order and check that all closes succeed. Open a new session on the TA. Send a command to read data and verify that the data matches what was previously written by the previously-opened TA. Close the client TA Open the client TA again Open a session to the server TA Read out the data values, which should match previously-written values Close session and check that it succeeds.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00402_MultiSessionKeepAlive_DataPreserved

TestCase_GC00502_MultiInstance_DataLost ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
Check that a multiple-instance TA does not keep its data between each close/OpenSession.
Test Steps:
Open a session on a multiple-instance TA and verify the result is TEE_SUCCESS. Send a command to read data and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Send a command with data that must be saved inside the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that it is the value that was previously sent. Close first session and check that it succeeds. Do a loop 5 of: Open an additional instance of the same TA and check that the result is TEE_SUCCESS Send a command to read data and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Send a command to write unique data into the TA (each session must use different data) Send a command to read data and verify that the data reflects the newly-written value. Send a command to read data from the first TA session and verify that it is the value that was previously sent to the first session. Close all sessions in a random order and check that all closes succeed. Open a new session on the TA. Send a command to read data from the TA and verify that the data are the default value (fulfill by TA at startup). Close session and check that it succeeds.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_030_TAModes.00100_CA2TA.GC00502_MultiInstance_DataLost
